com.yantra.api.ydm

Interface manageLoad

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YDMApi, YIFApi

    public interface manageLoad

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document manageLoad(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      Loads are made of Shipments that may or may not belong to a Delivery Plan.

    • Method Detail

      • manageLoad

        org.w3c.dom.Document manageLoad(YFSEnvironment env,
                                org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                         throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                java.rmi.RemoteException
        Loads are made of Shipments that may or may not belong to a Delivery Plan. A Load picks up these Shipments at either the Shipment's Ship Node or at some other address. Similary, a Load drops a Shipment either at the Shipment's destination or at some other intermediate address from where a different Load could pick it up and eventually deliver to the buyer. These pickup and drop off points are called Stops and more specifically LoadStops.
        This API provides the ability to do the following:
        • Create an empty Load.
        • Add Shipments to a Load.
        • Remove Shipments from a Load.
        • Resequence Stops of the Load.
        • Add Load to a manifest.
        • Remove Load from a manifest.
        • Resequence Stops of the Load.
        • Modify other attributes of Load like Instructions or Charges.
        • Delete a Load. All Shipments in the Load are removed and marked as Not Planned.
        • Generate PRO number for Loads with LTL (Less Than Truck Load) shipment mode. Also generate PRO number for a load, if shipment mode changes from any other mode to LTL.
        • Re-generate PRO number if the Carrier changes.

        • In the scenerio where the Carrier sends the load updates with the Load Shipment details before the shipment updates arrive, manageLoad API creates a Load Shipment record without the complete shipment details.
        • Load Shipment record should contain one of the following three combinations ShipmentNo, ShipNode and SellerOrganizationCode OR BolNo and ShipNode OR ProNo and ShipNode.
        • If the shipment corresponding to the Load Shipment record is created, the Load Shipment record is updated with the Shipment information.
        • This Creation of Load Shipment records while creating load without the prescence of the shipment is available only if the rule Allow Addition of Shipments not Available on System to a Load is enabled in the configuration.
        • The Load Stops need to be explicitly defined in the input.
        For Loads which require shipment level integration, this API does not allow follwing modifications once manifestation has started:
        • Adding new Shipments to Load.
        • Removing existing Shipments from Load.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD


        User Exits: This API calls the following user exit before performing any operations on the input XML passed to this API: com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMBeforeCreateLoad.

        These user exits are called only if pro number generation is required for the load.
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMGetNextProNoUE.
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMComputeCheckDigitUE.


        Events Raised:

        Events raised during transaction CREATE_LOAD

          ON_SUCCESS:
            Data Published - YDM_CREATE_LOAD.ON_SUCCESS.html, YDM_CREATE_LOAD.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
            Key data - load_dbd.txt

        Events raised during transaction MODIFY_LOAD

          ON_SUCCESS:
            Data Published - YDM_MODIFY_LOAD.ON_SUCCESS.html, YDM_MODIFY_LOAD.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
            Key data - load_dbd.txt
          ON_DOCK_ASSIGNMENT:
            Data Published - YDM_MODIFY_LOAD.ON_DOCK_ASSIGNMENT.html, YDM_MODIFY_LOAD.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
            Key data - load_dbd.txt
          ON_TRAILER_ASSIGNMENT:
            Data Published - YDM_MODIFY_LOAD.ON_TRAILER_ASSIGNMENT.html, YDM_MODIFY_LOAD.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
            Key data - load_dbd.txt

        Template Support:
        Yes.

        Audits:
        If a new Load is being created, YFS_LOAD_STATUS_AUDIT record is written indicating the creation of the load.

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes.

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains all the information about the Loads. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes. in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
